title: Self Promo Question
content:
What is ethical to include in self-promotion? Specifically, can you include work you created while working at other shops? How do you deal with collaborative work? Too many details about what you’ve contributed can start to sound a little crazy.

Also, my wife is an editor, and I’m working with ideas to incorporate what she does and market ourselves as a package. How do I handle work she is involved with currently since she is employed by an institution?

 [‹ Gerrit Noordzij's books](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142631/http:/typophile.com/node/13875 "Go to previous forum topic") [Remembering AtypI 95 Barcelona ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081022142631/http:/typophile.com/node/13995 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jupiterboy

comments.content: Most **working** people build their portfolios while working for someone, whether clients or a boss. As long as you (and your wife) actually **did** the work you are claiming to have done, there shouldn’t be a problem. And, if you worked as a member of a team, be honest about that.

Honest is crucial and your reputation is affected by credibility.

In my CV, I have a section called: _Summary of Projects, Collaborations and Consultancies_

My own guidelines for wording:  
For projects I did — _created, developed_ at or for  
projects I directed — _directed_  
Part of project team — _collaborated with, contributed to_  
Consulting — depends on level — _consulted, contributed, directed_

—————————————————————————————————————————  
Yes, I’m old, but consult my creative consultants when collaborating!

Thanks guys. I like Norberts take and specific wording. I have a tendency to get a bit too technical, which can make me seem a bit wobbly.

Oldnick. Not sure about your bold usage. Hope I’ve not done anything to make myself seem suspicious. I have never and would never misrepresent myself, although I can see from posts on Typophile that this is more common than I might suspect.

Here’s an example. My wife just finished editing a catalogue for an upcoming exhibition of the work of Anselm Kiefer. I’m not the designer on the project. If I show the book I’ll be very clear about what’s what. My question would be whether to show an image of the book or not?
